summary: This document is an email chain from November 28, 2019, between Mark Steward of the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and an unnamed US prosecutor's office (likely SDNY). Steward urgently inquires about an active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, specifically regarding his relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division, and seeks to coordinate a discussion.

persons.name: Mark Steward
persons.role: Executive Director of Enforcement and Market Oversight at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
persons.context: Initiates contact with a US prosecutor's office to inquire about the active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his connections to JP Morgan.

persons.name: Kate Tuckley
persons.role: FCA staff member (likely in business support or enforcement)
persons.context: Coordinates scheduling for a call between Mark Steward and the US prosecutor's office regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Kelly Eldred
persons.role: Personal Assistant to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Listed as Mark Steward's PA in email signature and copied on correspondence.

persons.name: Harry Caldecott
persons.role: Private Secretary to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Listed as Mark Steward's Private Secretary in email signature and copied on correspondence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Client of JP Morgan's private wealth division, subject of investigation
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of an active investigation by a US prosecutor's office, specifically regarding his financial dealings with JP Morgan.

connections.description: Steward, representing the UK FCA, is seeking information from US prosecutors about an active investigation into Epstein's financial world.
Tuckley assists Steward in scheduling an urgent call with US prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.
Eldred is identified as Steward's Personal Assistant in his email signature.
Caldecott is identified as Steward's Private Secretary in his email signature.
Epstein is identified as a client of JP Morgan's private wealth division, which is a point of interest for the investigation.

events.title: FCA inquiry into Epstein investigation
events.description: Mark Steward of the UK FCA sends an urgent email to a US prosecutor's office seeking confirmation and coordination on the active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding JP Morgan.

events.title: Scheduled call between FCA and US prosecutors
events.description: A call is scheduled for 4:15 PM UK time between Mark Steward (FCA) and US prosecutors to discuss the Epstein investigation.

locations: 12 Endeavour Square, London E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA headquarters)
keyFacts: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) was actively seeking information from US prosecutors about the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in November 2019.
The FCA's inquiry specifically mentioned Epstein's status as a client of JP Morgan's private wealth division as an area of interest.
The communication was marked as 'Confidential & Urgent', indicating the sensitivity and priority of the matter for the UK regulator.
The primary US contact's name is redacted in the document, but they are described as running a specific unit that oversees the Epstein case.
The correspondence occurred on Thanksgiving Day in the US (November 28, 2019), highlighting the urgency perceived by the FCA.
